review.title: Disappointing!
review.reviewText: We were expecting great things with the Hilton name attached to it but saw the opposite. First, check in at 10pm was a mess. It took forever! There is no free breakfast which was one of the requests for booking my trip since I was travelling with 6 kids. I couldn't believe they had double beds and not queens like most other hotels. Also, our shower knob came off when we tried to use the tub. When we called down to the desk, they said they would call maintenance. An hour later, we called to see what was going on and they tell us that maintenance wouldn't be in until later that day! Really! Why didn't they say this when I called the first time. We asked for another room but they would not move us (they said they had no more rooms) however, we were there the night before and heard there were additional rooms! The towels smelled dirty and the rooms were musky. Never again!
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby was the only thing we liked about this hotel.

review.title: Decent to come back to
review.reviewText:
I definitely see this as a traveler's hotel rather than extended stay of several or more days hotel.  

The parking area was huge and it is shared with another hotel and suites' parking.  So plenty of parking.  

The staff was trained well because they were super friendly and respectful.   haven't had anyone say "my pleasure" in all my stays in the States.  I only hear that internationally.  Good training company.

Now onto the hotel room.  It was pretty clean but the bed was more on the firm side (which some of you may love but not for me).  I do not have a good back to begin with and the bed made my back and my hips ache (I had to take several advils every night before I went to bed).  The walls are thin.   I can hear any noise made in the hallway and upstairs (I can even hear the person above me do a number one).  So I used my earplugs every night.  

They give you complimentary bottled water and they have chocolate chip cookies and oatmeal cookie in the lobby area (yum!!!). They also provide, hot tea, and coffee, and flavored water (with fruits and lemon, etc).  Good stuff.  I always get me some hot tea before I head to bed.

So all in all, I would go back because the price was decent for the holidays.  But the bed situation and the thinner walls would make me look around first before I book this one again.  But I do like the area a lot because plenty of food places to go to.  I tried 3 diners 5 minutes away from here.  Good places.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, free drinks and cookies.
review.negativeRemarks: Put some foam or gel toppers on the bed for those who have bad backs.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of great food places to go.  I went to their Costco and they have an organic section!  WHAT? I don't even get that in my Costco.

review.title: Close, clean and convenient to the airport
review.reviewText:
My wife and I had an early flight from SFO so we started looking for bargains near the airport.  Unfortunately, there are no "bargains" so we took the cheapest of the well known hotels closest to the airport which was the Hilton Garden Inn.  It's very easy to get to.  Good menu in the restaurant in the hotel.  Rooms very clean with all the amenities.  Shuttle times were not posted on their website but they run starting at 4:00 a.m. and on the half-hour.  Unfortunately our shuttle had several grumpy travelers who didn't cut our shuttle driver much slack ("Can't you go any faster?", "Be careful with that bag. I paid a lot of money for that thing!"  etc...) but he took it all in stride.

Solid thumbs up and I only wish it was a little cheaper, but then, after all it's San Francisco!

review.title: Clean, quiet and very economical
review.reviewText: After running around San Francisco all day, we looked forward to going to the hotel to rest. The lobby is welcoming with flavored water, coffee, tea and hot cocoa at your disposal. There is a cute teeny tiny full service bar to the left (nice strong drinks served here!) and a mini restaurant with plenty of sitting.  To the right a large dinning table separated by a fireplace for privacy.  Overall a great setup! Rooms were clean, AC worked great. Small fridge and microwave in the room....which I found out you have to request at other local hotels in San Francisco...so it was greatly appreciated.  ALSO, parking is free.....another luxury in San Francisco.  Well worth the drive, as it is not right next to all of the touristy hot spots, but conveniently located near a pet hotel for our little Charley.

review.title: Excellent hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText:
I spent 4 nights here while moving my daughter into her new apartment at SFSU.  Finding a decent hotel near SFSU is challenging, so I have started staying closer to the airport.  This hotel is in a quiet location, and the staff are outstanding!  Friendly, helpful, and prompt in all aspects of service.  Also, free parking!

My main consideration in rating a hotel highly is cleanliness.  This hotel was extremely clean and we had no problems during our stay.  The bed was too soft - my back & neck weren't happy about sinking into a soft pit in the center of the mattress - but it was tolerable.  Also, if you are sensitive to noise, ask for a room that is NOT a room with an adjoining door to the next room.  We could hear his phone conversations, his choice of tv viewing, and some dubious body noises.

The food at the hotel restaurant was very good.  The Bacon n' Brie mashed potatoes were heavenly!  And the food service staff were also extremely friendly and efficient.  I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again, and would definitely recommend it highly.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the airport, perfect if you have an early morning flight.

* Free parking and free Wi-Fi!!!
* Complementary cookies
* San Francisco is a short drive (or BART trip) away
* Rooms were small but clean and comfortable, with heavenly pillows on the bed
* No pool, but great exercise room
* Microwave and frig in room

I discovered, unfortunately as we were leaving, that South San Francisco has a very quaint downtown (on Grand), just minutes from the hotel, on the west side of the freeway. Wish I'd had time to check it out.
review.positiveRemarks: The people, the location, and the free amenities
review.negativeRemarks: No pool. Not many restaurants or grocery stores within the area.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
We usualy enjoy Garden Inn hotels. We felt upset when we realized the pool was taken away. We choosed that hotel to spend the last day in San Francisco before a 20 hours back home fight. We put our bath suits on to go to the pool and at the front desk we were told the was not pool in th hotel enymore...we would choose a different hotel if we were told that before in expedia. A Pool photo is still on the hotel review:
(http://www.expedia.com.ar/San-Francisco-Hoteles-Hilton-Garden-Inn-San-Francisco-Airport-North.h296720.Informacion-Hotel?c=11585200-02b0-43a4-87d6-a6c2a3e67836&&chkin=02/03/2013&hashTag=default&hwrqCacheKey=90322938-b618-489d-8380-afe700511ac4HWRQ1361736351077&chkout=03/03/2013&c=7e354b09-dca5-4fcc-9dec-3a9ef237c8fa&rfrr=-30462&rm1=a2&)
review.negativeRemarks: No pool. Althouhg there is photo in the review
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for airport

review.title: Renovation in January - Feb
review.reviewText: It was going through a renovation. But they did offer free Breakfast to make up for it. I would go back after the renovation.
review.locationRemarks: good location to the airport

review.title: Lovely hotel for family
review.reviewText: I would definitely say it's a lovely hotel. Near airport and has complimentary airport pickup. We drove around SF, so transportation was not an issue, but if you are traveling without car, it's a bit inconvenient to get around, but still, it's located close to downtown SF, around 15 mins drive.
review.locationRemarks: close to airport.

review.title: gratifying experience
review.reviewText: Staff welcomed us at the checkin and explained hotel services. Breakfast was outstanding. King size bed and bedding was very comfortable. A quiet area and no airplane noise. Quick on and off to expressway.
review.locationRemarks: Quiet and close to good restaurants.

review.title: lovely ho0tel
review.reviewText: Extremely accomodatimg staff, very friendly and helpful. A nice touch, cookies at the desk for a midnight snack. Also very helpful shuttle service to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: unattractive view of parking lot =from the window.
review.locationRemarks: near to the airport

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Great service, friendly staff. Food was good. Great location right near the airport, yet an easy drive into downtown. Would stay here again.

review.title: Inconvenient
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was fine - clean and comfortable but if you need to go into the City for business it is very inconvenient. There was a big conference in town and getting a taxi from the hotel was almost impossible. I would not stay here again if I had daily business in the City.

review.title: Well worth a look and the value
review.reviewText: Bright, clean efficient, convenient, great value. Staff are very keen to make sure you have an enjoyable stay.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for SFO. Not bad for downtown if you are OK with using trains

review.title: 3-night-stay
review.reviewText: the hotel was nice and clean. staff is friendly and helpful. overall , we liked the hotel.

review.title: Great way to get away from it all !
review.reviewText: It was a great experience. Just having everyone at the hotel so helpful and so friendly.
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Visiting San Fran
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable room. Reasonable rate. Very friendly staff. Great breakfast buffet for $12.95. Close to downtown San Fran.
review.negativeRemarks: Business center computer was very slow and did not have the most recent software.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport and downtown San Fran.

review.title: Favourite place to stay when in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Although the hotel itself is modern, cheerful and very well kept, it was the kindness and efficiency of the staff which really made my stay! The breakfast buffet was a straightforward, but pleasing, selection; the room was clean and neat; coffee and tea were on tap; and the in-room microwave and fridge were very, very welcome indeed. The hotel location was quiet, peaceful, and ever so convenient. I can wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone in need of a very reasonably priced and comfortable place to stay that's none too far from either San Francisco or the airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Microwave and fridge in room, comfortable bed, coffee and tea to go
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently close to San Francisco and the airport, but quiet

review.title: Very Good Rooms, Staff & Food
review.reviewText: Perfect room---quiet and clean. The workout/cardio room was too small though---they shouldn't advertise it unless it can accommodate more people.
review.locationRemarks: Great access to SFO

review.title: Good location, free parking!
review.reviewText: The hotel is located near the San Francisco airport (no more than 10 minutes away). Building, grounds, lobby and room were clean and well maintained. I stayed in a room with two full-size beds. There were 4 of us, and it was not that cramped. The indoor pool is small, though. There is a hot-tub there, too. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant (breakfast buffet is $12.95 per person). Parking was free. You have to drive out a few miles to find good restaurants. There is only a scattering of fast-food restaurants nearby. The location is great because it is away from the hustle and bustle of San Francisco, but close enough to drive into the tourist areas within 15 - 20 minutes.
review.negativeRemarks: Not enough bath towels provided. Called front desk and never got the extra towel. Had to flag down a housekeeper for the extra towel.
review.locationRemarks: Quiet business area where several other large hotels are located. Near S.F. airport and within 15-20 mins drive to San Francisco.

review.title: Friendly
review.reviewText: I would stay here again. I would stay here again. I would stay here again. I would stay here again.

review.title: Great for Families headed to the airport.
review.reviewText: We arrived just at check in time to take a nap - the crib was delivered as soon as they could. The boys took a bath after a swim around the pool. I never let my kids take a bath at a hotel. It was very clean and they did a great job! We got to the airport with no problems. they have their own shuttle - not shared like some hotels.

review.title: Good price for quality and convenience
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, quick check in and check out. The pool is small, but it's indoors and close to the airport so that's not bad. There's no free breakfast like other hotels in the same class, but it's a great location to visit San Francisco in general and the wineries.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the major highway, San Francisco, airport and the wineries.

review.title: A candidate while searching a stay near SFO
review.reviewText:
They offer on demand shuttle bus to and from SFO, as long as you call the hotel.

My package does not include breakfast.

review.title: Good after bad
review.reviewText:
I had some issues with my room when i checked in (they had me in 2 double beds and i had booked a room with a king bed) and although they were unable to accomodate me in a king that night cause they were 100 percent booked they had me in the king room the following evening and they comped me breakfast for my troubles.
The staff was excellent and very friendly

review.title: Ticks all the boxes!
review.reviewText:
I have travelled internationally extensively both on business and on vacation and the standard of this hotel would meet the most fastidious of travellers.
The staff are extremely friendly and go out of their way to assist.
The buffet breakfast is superb.
If you are looking for an airport hotel this one ticks all the boxes.
The airport shuttle runs every 30 minutes and can also be used to connect to the BART rail system if you want to visit the "city on the bay"!

review.title: hilton garden inn review
review.reviewText: Convenient and priced right.Pleasant staff.Food could be better for the price.

review.title: Decent Location
review.reviewText: You get what you paid for. The location is not in the middle of city but it's a decent spot if you are not willing to pay for parking and internet.
review.locationRemarks: Away from the busy city and free parking. Nothing to complain about

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Had a great stay, also restaurant was fantastic! Lots of parking as well.

review.title: Comfy beds and clean facility.
review.reviewText: The indoor hot tub was awesome! The receptionists were very helpful and knowledgeable. The beds were ultra comfy and the resturaunt was about average. I enjoyed the hotel and the closeness to my conference. Nice people....

review.title: No Sleep Hotel - Bad Air Conditioners
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with one exception. The room AC/heating was terrible: extremely loud and drafty. The AC unit (GE) reminded me of the 1980's in San Felipe Mexico - 3rd World. There is no excuse for loud air conditioning today - One of the primary reasons for going to a hotel is to sleep and when the AC makes this impossible because of noise and/or comfort then the hotel has failed. Too bad because this hotel is great otherwise.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: It was great! Next to the airport, very good option

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly staff and convenient location. No parking fees! Will return next time to SF.

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: This as usual is a very nice clean place to stay.. the staff were excellent!

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The reception staff were very helpful and guided us the best way to get into town. Even pointing out some attractions on a map for us to check out. Room was very tidy and clean. Internet was a bit slow but no big deal. Swimming pool and gym were both very good. Would happily stay again

review.title: the right hotel for our travel needs while in San Francisco
review.reviewText: After 4 1/2 hectic flight from chicago, we were greeted by two smiling and hospitable desk clerks (Tess) and another oriental male. Our room was ready and took 2 minutes to get us going to our room. Overall stay was within our expectations. Very good.

review.title: Average, run of the mill hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was average, the furniture in the lobby was sagging and stained. The front desk staff weren't very friendly. They weren't rude, but weren't warm or welcoming, especially the women. The windows in the room hadn't been cleaned and were smudged,. The glasses were also dirty. The bed had a sunken hole that made my back ache for days. Overall it was just a blah stay at a semi clean hotel with unfriendly staff.

review.title: Convenient and Comfortable
review.reviewText: This is a convenient hotel for those needing quick access to the airport. It's clean, well run and comfortable, with all the services we wanted for a short stay. Free shuttle bus was appreciated.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown San Francisco near Fisherman's wharf as there's lots going on, reasonable restaurants and it gives a good view of the bay. Use cable car and BART to get around

review.title: decent
review.reviewText: There was a bug in the bathroom, but other than that it was decent

review.title: will use again
review.reviewText: Nice and clean and prompt service.

review.title: Never been disappointed by Hilton
review.reviewText: We had an early flight out, so we stayed close to the airport. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very clean. We used the business center to print our boarding passes. And the shuttle took us and picked us up at the train station, and took us to the airport the next morning. Very satisfied!

review.title: unbiased rating
review.reviewText: This hotel was really good. We got it for a very good price on expedia. The best part of this hotel is their breakfast. I was impressed for all the food that was served there. You eat till you are full. The waiters and waitresses were very kind and super nice. The location of the place is excellent, away from the noisy city and yet very closed to the San Francisco Downtown (about 10 to 15 min drive). The only little thing that bothered me a little bit is the AC was too noisy and the bed a little bit uncomfortable. But for the price, I really did not mind especially with all the food that was served in the morning. It was a good staying. Hope people find it attractive to spend a short vacation like we did.

review.title: Experience
review.reviewText: Overrall it was a good experience with the exception of my injury. My only compliant is that I had an injury onsite and Management did not write up an incident report. It bothered me that the Manager knew about my injury and waited for me to let her know what happened. If Expedia passes this comment along to the Chain Owners of the Hilton I stayed at I would like to discuss further.

review.title: San Francisco or bust
review.reviewText:
Very good value for the money. After all, you're going to be tired from all the wonderful things to do in SF and you'll be beat at the end of the day. You'll find a friendly face when you get back and a comfy bed.

We started our days with a great breakfast (which was included in our deal). I had freshly made omelettes, pancakes, french toast et al during our week's stay. Highly recommended!

review.title: Ready to go back to San Francisco !
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely courteous and friendly. The breakfast was excellent which was included with the room. Will definitely go back to this hotel on our next trip to San Francisco!

review.title: very good hotel but ....
review.reviewText: very good hotel but far from interesting sights of san francisco and no public transport near

review.title: Convenient and comfortable
review.reviewText:
Handy for airport with a good shuttle service. Rooms spacious and very comfortable but the cleaning was not brilliant - I found a very old mint chocolate just under my bed so no one had cleaned there for some time! Had this not happened, I might have thought differently. Good free laundry, computer centre and wi-fi to rooms. Microwave and fridge in room but no plates, knives or forks - only plastic ones available on request!
The restaurant was very variable - a rather small, unimaginative menu with the standard of food differing wildly from one day to the next. One pizza arrived actually raw! No breakfast room service which was a big negative and breakfast mediocre. I stopped eating there after a few days except in emergencies as it was boring and unreliable.
Position overall quite good and near the freeway to downtown but not so good for public transport. I chose this so as to be able to take trips both into the city (though the traffic can be terrible) and out of the city - again the main problem is the traffic and congestion and it is best to travel early or late. Trips to the south - such as Santa Cruz and Monterey took many hours because of congestion.
Above average in most respects therefore except food and the local area =- better probably for business trips.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: Staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel spotless, airy, inviting. Room extremely comfortable. A bit far from downtown and difficult to get to City. Perfect for airport.

review.title: Hilton San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Decent hotel for the price. Its about 20 minutes away from the city. Its probably not a great hotel if your traveling with kids. The pool is small.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: This hotel l was more than I had expected...great location for my needs; clean and comfortable room; restaurant on site; easy access and parking. Staff was very friendly and professional. In all, a very pleasurable stay, especially for the price.

review.title: Return the second time
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. this is my scond time back and staff are friendly. Breakfast are great with lots of variety. All the TVs have switchd to flat screen the date we check out. Will definitely return in the future.

review.title: Nice Hotel but didn't like the location.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but out of the way, no resturants in walking distance and far from downtown. Breakfast was awsome and the indoor pool was great!

review.title: Good hotel, good price
review.reviewText: The hotel was extremely clean and the beds were so comfortable. The breakfast buffet was delicious and I would defintiely stay there again

review.title: great hotel but small pool
review.reviewText: This hotel was great, clean, soft beds, exercise room hot tub and swimming pool. The pool was quite little but it still made for a great time for my 3 kids and the pool hours were great. Something like 6 am to 11 pm! Would recommend it to anyone.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: the service wasn't as we expected, it took them 2 hours to bring us extra blankets. the bed was uncomfortable and the hotel room were small. I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

review.title: Excellent Value!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is conveniently located near SF Airport, San Bruno (shopping), Daly City (more shopping) and not far from downtown San Francisco. Very reasonable rates, no charge for parking, refrigerator and microwave in the room, and no fee parking. The rooms are clean, service is great and they offer a great breakfast at a reasonable price. Also near Oyster Point where there is a nice recreation trail for biking, running or walking around the bay.

It was a very nice stay!

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at a number of Hilton Garden Inns, and have always been extremely satisfied. This hotel was a disappointment. We were given a room next to the indoor pool. The entire floor smelled like pool chemicals and the machinery noise was very loud. We asked for another room. This room, despite being a non smoking room on a non smoking floor, reeked of cigarette smoke.
We were very tired after our flight, so we decided to stay put. Around 3am the fire alarm went off. Half an hour later the people in the adjoining room started trying to open the adjoining door. Repeatedly. Housekeeping came while we were resting after breakfast (8 am) We told them we were still there, and to please come back later. After several repetitions, she finally understood and left us in peace.

review.title: Quiet place not too far from the city
review.reviewText: It's always nice and quiet when we come here, and so clean! It's a nice mini-vacation from the city, but not so far away that it takes you so long to get out here. There isn't much to do here but that's of no concern to me

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: really a nice hotel, i like it

review.title: Would definitely return.
review.reviewText: We found everything in order on our trip: our room was what was requested. The full breakfast was freshly prepared and on the day we had to leave the hotel at 6 am we were given "to go" boxes to take some food with us. The coffee in the room is excellent: not average like most places and I loved having 2 bottles of FREE water for our use.

review.title: Good value and location if you're driving to S.F.
review.reviewText: My family and I were planning a road trip to S.F. during the holidays and were looking for a clean hotel with amenities that would make our stay enjoyable, but not take up too much of our travel budget. I researched several hotels for price, location, amenities, and other travelers opinions, and the Hilton Garden Inn seemed like the best choice for the price. It offered free WiFi, a breakfast buffet (got the breakfast package), an indoor heated pool, and free parking. Our overall experience at the hotel was great. The staff was very nice and helpful, especially the morning staff in the dining area. The evening staff in the dining area was less friendly, but we only ate there one evening, so it didn't bother us much. The breakfast buffet was a typical American breakfast, but was good and included made to order omlettes. We made good use of the free internet to help us plan our daily activities. The indoor pool was not very big, but my children enjoyed it and there were few people using it when we were there. For those driving to S.F., having free parking was a big plus. Some nearby hotels were charging $15 a night, while downtown hotels were charging $25-$45 a night. As for location, it was freeway close and only about a 10 min drive to downtown S.F. The hotel and room was clean and comfortable, with the only complaint being that they have double beds instead of queen beds. This makes it a little tight when sleeping two to a bed.

review.title: Helpful & Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Hotel was perfect for early morning international flight the next day (I live in the Bay Area). When I arrived fresh-baked cookies were being served. I wasn't impressed by the in-house eatery (it's part of the lobby and has a very limited dinner menu, altho' I hear the breakfast is good; I had to leave before breakfast service started), so asked about nearby restaurants. Front desk staff reco'd several and the Thai suggestion appealed to me. When I asked if it was in walking distance, they said, "Oh, no, the shuttle will take you there and pick you up when you're done!" Not only was the restaurant great, but the shuttle was as well - it was like having my own private limo service. Dropped me off in front and picked me up w/in minutes after I called for pickup. Room was comfy and more spacious than I expected. Also, I was there on New Year's Eve and worried about guest noise - didn't hear a thing. Morning shuttle was also on time (5 a.m.!). I'd definitely stay here again next time I have an early morning flight. My thanks to the friendly and knowledgeable staff and shuttle driver!

review.title: Convenient location for SFO
review.reviewText: It was pleasure stay over all. However, the bed was uncomfortable with old springs.

review.title: " A great place to stay, where you can feel at home with great service"
review.reviewText: At check-in, it was what we expected plus 1000 times more. We arrived at the hotel about 9:00 am and we had tickets to the Raiders football game that day and were supposed meet some friends at the stadium for a tailgating party. Since we had just arrived from the airport we were going to ask if we could put our luggage in storage for security reasons but instead of asking she checked us in with no problems and we were ecstatic. We settled and got ready feeling fresh and clean. We took the bart to the game and it was an amazing day. The people at the front desk whether it be morning or night gave both my husband & I a 5 star service. We really felt so comfortable and safe at the hotel. The morning staff who worked everyday during our stay at the restaurant was always courteous and professional. We felt like we were at home. Being that we are from Hawaii and were spending our 18th anniversary there it was like being at home. The "Aloha Spirit" was throughout the hotel. I definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again when visiting San Francisco. Thank you to all the staff at the Hilton Garden Inn San Francisco Airport North. We really appreciated your superb service. Bravo to you!!! Also to expedia, we would like to thank you for a great deal you provided for our trip. Will be using expedia again for our future trips.

review.title: Nice Hotel with a great staff
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! Just a few minutes from Candlestick Park, about 10-15 minutes from Fisherman's Wharf and downtown. It's in a quiet part of San Francisco, which makes it great. It's very clean! The hotel lobby has complimentary coffee, tea, hot chocolate, and cookies. The room was great. I'll stay there again next time I visit!

review.title: Nice Hotel Near Airport
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the Hilton Garden Inn. The rooms were great... the service very good... the breakfast was outstanding. And to top it off, the price was very reasonable. Highly recommended.

review.title: Good for the family.
review.reviewText: Travelling with young kids can be tough. The staff was great.

review.title: Convenience can't be beat!
review.reviewText: The Garden Inns are some of the best kept secrets for value and comfort. Priced right, comp breakfast, free wifi, comfortable bedding... who could ask for anything more?

review.title: awaywego
review.reviewText: My daughter needed to be at the airport at 5am, so rather than drive, leaving at 3am, we decided to find a motel nearby that would shuttle us. This was the perfect hotel. The room was spacious, the beds comfortable, the staff friendly, and I was able to accompany her to and from the airport without having to park or just drop her off.

review.title: Comfortable
review.reviewText: Nice hotel

review.title: Great Hotel & location for 49ers game
review.reviewText: overall room & location were great! i would prefer a firmer bed & higher water pressure but thats just me!! the room had a great view. and for my next trip i will for sure stay here!

review.title: Good place to stay with kids
review.reviewText: I travelled to San Francisco with my 2 children and the first thing I noticed was how clean, neat and accomodating everything looked inside the hotel. The staff were very friendly to us and even offered cookies to my kids whenI checked in. My kids enjoyed their stay there the most because their breakfast buffet was fabulous ( and free!) and they had a great time swimming in the heated indoor pool. Great thing that their pool was indoor because it was windy and chilly that early month of September.

review.title: Decent Airport Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a perfectly nice HGI for an airport hotel. It's only about 10 minutes drive from the airport and close to the 101 for travelers. The only problem is that it's not very close to a BART station if you want to get up into the city - you have to drive to one or take the hotel shuttle to the airport.

review.title: LOVED IT!
review.reviewText: I WENT ON THIS TRIP W MY HUSBAND AND I GOTTA SAY ITS HAS BEEN ONE OF THE CLEANEST I'VE EVER BEEN TO. THE STAFF WAS VERY HELPFUL AND NICE. THE COMPLEMENTARY BREAKFAST WAS DELICIOUS, SIMPLE BUT VERY TASTEFULL. NO ONE EVER BOTHERED US AND THE CLEANING CREW NEVER DISTURBED US EITHER. DEFINETLY STAYING HERE ON MY NEXT TRIP

review.title: nice stay
review.reviewText: The hotel restaurant was only so so but everything else was very nice.

review.title: Great location w/o the parking expense of being in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Check in was fine but the lady never smiled even when I "try to make conversation" with her. If you are going to work at the front desk, you should at least "pretend" you are happy. Beds seemed smaller; either way was not comfortable. Rooms were clean, location great, good breakfast but they should open up more seating for breakfast.

review.title: would not go back
review.reviewText: Did not sleep bed was very bad in need of replacing

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location (if you need to get to SF airport) for an early flight. Real good value for money - parking and internet access included!

review.title: excellent hotel value near the airport
review.reviewText: Excekllent value near airport. We used this hotel as a jumping off point to go hiking for a week in Yosemite. We then came back on Friday to be near the airport for early Sat morning. Also the retaurant was very good for dinner.

review.title: My New Favorite Hotel to Stay at When Visiting San Francisco
review.reviewText: The staff is A+, The hotel is very clean with lots of parking. The morning Breakfast was A+. The room was very comfortable and CLEAN!! Close to San Francisco by car . There is a train that runs into the city from there not to far from the hotel. We were there for two S.F. Giants Games and to visit our old Favorite haunts. We used to stay at the Embassy Suites just up the street. But no more. We plan on staying at other Hilton Garden Inn's in our future plan's. I used to work for a large Airline and have stayed in lots of hotels aound the world and this place had everything we needed to make for a great getaway.

review.title: Not that impressed
review.reviewText:
I booked the room on a promotional deal that full breakfast was included every morning. The breakfast itself was okay, typical All-American breakfast with eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, waffles, etc, but the service was horrible. On the first morning, when we wanted to sit down at a table, the waiter (not sure if I should call him a waiter but he helps clear off tables) rudely asked us to change tables. I felt quite embarrassed.

The room was alright, nothing too fancy. The bed was comfortable and the toiletries were good. There is not that much around the area, which was expected.

review.title: Good enough to bring home to mom
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable, friendly staff, free yum-full breakfast, and neutrogena products in the bathroom. What else could you want?

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The staff is super friendly and accomodating. The pool is indoors which is great, but its kind of small. Room was clean and bed was nice and soft. Restaurant only open for breakfast and dinner, but food was great. Location is close to the airport and a very short drive to all the sites. Great place to stay if you want to see San Francisco without the excessive price of staying directly in town. I would definately stay here again.

review.title: SFO easy
review.reviewText: When haveing a meeting in SFO it is close from the car rental and close to the airport. When flying from abroad to SFO this really helps after a 12 hour flight.

review.title: The best hotel ive ever stayed in. Would love to go back
review.reviewText: excellent hotel. everything is setup very nice. check in was easy with no problems. went to our room and was blown away. great setup, very very clean. the best bed most comfortable bed. ice machine on every floor. great dinner menu. everyone from the staff was very nice and would greet you. nice pool and excercise area. great laundry service for guests. And you get free breakfast coupons for the breakfast buffet from 6am to 10am. its the best food ever. lots of variety. Its better than some restaurants out there. if your a breakfast person you will love this breakfast. the location around the hotel is very quiet, not alot of stores and restaurants around but you can find some within a mile or so. would love to stay here again and will start looking for hilton garden inn's everywhere i go. this is a must stay.

review.title: Great hotel experience
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel to stay in for a weekend. Me and my boyfriend really loved how spaciaous it was and how clean it was. The staff is very friendly and they are always available.

review.title: Breakfast
review.reviewText: I loved the breakfast and the price was right.

review.title: A notch above average, but not perfect
review.reviewText: Has a good hot breakfast and free shuttle service to the airport. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and well kept. There was a strong musty smell in the hallway.

review.title: Convinient Airport Location for Drivers.
review.reviewText: Nothing short for what I expected. Located only five to ten minuites drive to/from SFO and fifteen at maxmum to the City's Civic Center while much cheeper compare to Downtown/Union Square hotels. Room equipped with fridge, microwave and abundant neutrogenas is clean and confortable until a maid knocks on the door at around 8 in the weekend morning. Though enough spaces between next door hotels are there, no special view is expected, therefore when you walk to the window to open the curtain in the morning, you end up finding yourself wake up in just another motel surrounded by an ample parking space. If you want a piece of San Francisco and/or want to move around the city by the cable cars avoid this location. But if you're on budget and still need to be behind the wheel, I definitely recommend this hotel. One of the best values in town.

review.title: Sensible Price for Comfort
review.reviewText: I liked Hilton Garden Inn hotel because check in and check out was so easy. The room was big and comfortable. It was also clean. I had more than usual food at breakfast. The staff was friendly and smiling all the time.

review.title: Good place to stay, away from the hubub of the city
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel with easy access to the freeway. The area was quiet, in more of a business park. Very nice. The beds were too small. but not much can be changed about that without great expense to the hotel. The hotel staff was extremely pleasant.

review.title: Quiet & Comfortable
review.reviewText: We'd been up for 30 hours by the time we got to the hotel. Checking out it's amenities was not on our priority list. But, the hotel was in a nice, quiet location, and close to SFO (but not too close). Breakfast was a little confusing; the buffet was spread out, and I didn't even see the eggs until I'd mostly finished eating. Otherwise, we had a very nice stay, and a refreshing start to our vacation.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: This hotel is not too far from downtown SF (about 15 minutes) and is what you would expect of a Hilton Garden Inn. The front desk was very helpful about places to go downtown at night. One thing though...every time we called housekeeping to request things, we tend to have to call twice for them to bring our stuff.

review.title: Affordable, comfortable and well located
review.reviewText: We were looking for a hotel that wont kill our budget on our San-Francisco trip, and was still of high class and close to the city. We found both here - the room was excellent and downtown or the peers were 10-15 away by car. This hotel is great if you have a vehicle on your trip, and don't mind staying a bit further from the center the city. Since we spent most of our time touring SF, we didn't mind it at all. It's also close to the interstate and major highways, and you can find a place to eat or shop nearby. Will definitely consider a second visit.

review.title: Excellent! Bravo!
review.reviewText: This hotel definitely earns a big 10 in my book! The front desk staff were courteous, friendly and helpful. The room was outstanding and very, very comfortable. The restaurant did not have a large menu, but the food was excellent. I utilized their park and fly service which was $25.00 for 8 days! Wow! Their free airport shuttle was helpful. I will definitely stay here again! Although my stay was just for one night, the quality of service was the best I've seen in quite some time. Do yourself a favor: STAY HERE!!

review.title: Good for families
review.reviewText: The combination of the indoor pool and hot tub and the breakfast buffet made this a good option for families looking to stay in the San Francisco area.

review.title: Clean & comfortable stay
review.reviewText: Three things I like Hilton Garden: 1). Location - near SF airport, surrounds by technology professional buildings, less traffic 2). Amenities - convenient mini-fridge, free use of washer & dryer, nice indoor pool. 3). Clean room

review.title: OK for overnight
review.reviewText: The hotel was fairly new, with lobby and bedrooms in good condition. The shuttle service from the airport was pretty efficient (10 minute wait after making phone contact) and allowed us to return later to get the BART to the city. Like most hotels around there, the "restaurant" was really a breakfast room and the bar was just a counter.

review.title: a good experience
review.reviewText: we stayed for 5 nights. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. The free shuttle to the airport was extremely helpful with us going down to the pier daily via the BART system. The breakfast buffet was very good and convienent. The only issue we had is we wished it was closer to the pier. it was about an hour commute each way from the hotel using the free shuttle to the airport, then BART and cable car systems to get downtown and to the piers.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I was surprised how clean it was overall me and my girlfriend really enjoyed the hotel and ill definitley go back and recomend it to a friend.

review.title: Clean, comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: This hotel is well maintained, clean and comfortable. I enjoyed my stay. The free airport shuttel is a great benefit.

review.title: Good, clean hotel with excellent service
review.reviewText: This hotel was very quiet. Its still fairly new so the rooms are clean and the entire facility was in great shape. Rooms are quiet, have both a wired and wireless internet connection, and the bed is amazing. Would stay here again.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Front desk staff was very friendly and accomodating. Great location close to the airport and football field.

review.title: Clean and Comfortable
review.reviewText: While not a luxury hotel, it was spacious, clean, and comfortable. It also had plenty of parking.

review.title: Very nice hotel, convenient to airport
review.reviewText: WE chose this location to be near the airport and were concerned when we got there when we were told that it was not that close to the Fisherman's Wharf & Union Square areas. As it turned out, when we found our way around, the location was good and we could get anywhere within 25-30 minutes. The hotel is very nice, staff was great and a very nice (but not fancy) in house restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Pricing at the airport hotels is much more reasonable that the "downtown" hotels". Given all factors I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Really Nice
review.reviewText: My stay was perfect. Clean and comfortable room. Although it is near the airport, there was no disturbing noise. I visit SF several times and year, and have found the perfect spot to stay again. Close to tourist attractions and relatives I visit!

review.title: Gives Hilton a bad name
review.reviewText: the hotel staff were unwilling to be accomodating with 2 exceptions. We had 4 of us with one bed. A roll-away finally arrived at 11 PM. We were moved into a handicap room on a smoking floor that smelled like chlorine to accomodate the size of the roll-away. Bathroom outside meeting room was dirty right after it was closed for cleaning. Everyone of the people in my class had some issue-mainly with the hotel staff. Won't go back! (And we are Gold card members of Hilton)

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Realy nice hotel with excellent people and service

review.title: Initial problems; rest of stay was fine
review.reviewText: Clearing through US immigration, we missed our connecting flights. Hence arrived day late at the hotel to find they had cancelled our reservation. Eventually got it sorted and were put up on smoking room with a promise of change of room the following day. Though we changed the room to non-smoking, we did not get rooms with beds for 2 and 3 people. The 2 beds per room, were not small for two people to sleep on. The rooms were big and cleaned daily; they could update TV sets and there were problems with one of the phone and the clock/alarm system. Apart from that everything else was fine. The hotel is in a good location for travel to and out of San Fransisco to other locations such as San Jose. The hotel is very close to the airport and the main highway and some of the shops and restaurants are few minutes drive away.

review.title: Comfortable and very nice place to stay.
review.reviewText: Great place to stay close to the airport. They seemed to have a "towel" issue; our family of four staying a week and a half had to ask for the fourth towel every day! Otherwise the stay was great. Really appreciated the refrigerator in the room.

review.title: Great Location for Candlestick Park
review.reviewText: Great location for access to Candlestick park for the football game.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel and staff were excellent. Arrived too late to use restaurant, recommended an excellent delivery restaurant. Price was reasonable, food was hot, and tasty. Room was ready upon arrival, had a free shuttle bus to and from airport making it very convenient. Only negative - Breakfast buffet did NOT replenish food, items other than made to order eggs were missing, and NOT replaced.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: The rooms were small and the staff was most unfriendly. Had to fight with staff to get the rooms that we needed and had booked on Expedia. Never a good morning or afternoon or good day or thanks from any of the hotel staff.

review.title: Impressive
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here over long weekend. It was our first weekend away from the kids in quite a while so I wanted to make sure we were staying at a nice place. We were both very impressed with this hotel. The beds were extra comfy, the room was nice and clean, the staff was great, and they have a nice breakfast buffet in the morning for a great price. The indoor pool and spa was nice too. The price was very reasonable for everything you get. We cant wait to go back and stay there again. We would highly recommend this wonderful hotel.

review.title: SF Hilton Garden Inn
review.reviewText: Affordable place. Clean and very friendly. Easy to get to the City and airport. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Impressed by Hilton Garden Inn
review.reviewText: It's much much better than what we expect. Very clean room, bed are comfortable. They even have LCD TV in our room. The only things is the Wi-fi internet, it didn't quiet stable. One suggestion it will be nice to include HD or digital progamme. Overall, it is one of the best hotel that we stay in Bay Area.

review.title: Great SFO hotel!!
review.reviewText: Very quiet and comfortable. Staff was helpful. Fitness center and indoor were a plus.

review.title: Nice San Francisco Bay Hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay. It was close to all of the areas that we wanted to go. We stayed there on a busy weekend and at night it was very quiet which is what we really liked about this hotel.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were pleasant but the bed smelled like urine. Would not stay there again.

review.title: Will stay here again
review.reviewText: We needed to stay one night near the SF airport on this trip. We booked at this hotel since it was reasonably priced and had good reviews. Due to some unexpected flight delays we arrived fairly late and was glad to find a very clean room with a comfortable bed. The staff was friendly. And the hotel was only about a couple of miles from the airport. Definitely good value for what we paid. We will book here again if we need to stay near the SF airport.

review.title: very nice
review.reviewText: far from the downtown, however very confortable

review.title: Staying At The Hilton
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel for the price it was at. My husband and I had a three day weekend up in SF and this was perfect just to relax in at night after a long day.

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: If you don't want to stay in the heart of the city, this is a great place. It has a very nice restaurant, not a big selection, but good food. They also have a nice indoor pool and workout room.

review.title: Will use this hotel on future trips!
review.reviewText: Close to Monster Park & airport. great staff, very helpful.

review.title: Will use again
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a quiet area and very comfortable. As a woman traveling alone, it felt safe. Loved the down comforter. Transport to and from airport was quick.

review.title: Well managed hotel.
review.reviewText: This is a well managed hotel. The staff was helpful and friendly. The only hiccup during my three-days stay was that the elevators broke down twice.

review.title: Very nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Totally worth the price. Very nice and roomy. Good location. Quite night and no airport sounds.

review.title: Nice Hotel - Restaurant needs help
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and pleasant. The beds were comfortable even with 4 of us having to sleep in two twin beds. However, the restaurant needs some help. The food was adequate, but the service was very slow and unattentive. And the main problem is that is the only place to eat - there are no other restaurants close to the hotel. Another complaint is there is no continental breakfast. They offer a "buffet" which is much less than most free breakfasts at other places.

review.title: Well maintained and comfortable
review.reviewText: I would return to the Hilton Garden Inn, SFO North... they were friendly and helpful, and the room was clean and comfortable. My wife and I had a short stay, so I can't comment on their food or swimming pool, but based on the rest of the hotel, I am sure they are great. Have fun in San Fran!

review.title: best time yet,can t wait to go back.go 9ers
review.reviewText: found the hotel staff very good and acomidating.the room was clean and had no problem with anything.very friendly and the breakfast buffet was good.very acomindating for getting cabs and infoming you on the chaffuer service.the city was great to see and visit and can t wait to go back.girlfriend love it and took lots of pictures.went there for a holiday and to see the 49ers play.got the best of both worlds,a 49ers win and to saw a beautiful city

review.title: Nice hotel at a good price
review.reviewText: No complaints. Room was clean and comfortable, location is convenient to SFO. Not a picturesque neighborhood, but quiet and safe.

review.title: Not Bad
review.reviewText: The hotel is very convenient for San Franciso airport and perfect if you are arriving from a long haul flight. Check in was efficient and the room was clean and nicley decorated. The Fitness room facilities are a little limited.

review.title: What you would expect
review.reviewText: We only used our room and the excercise facility. The room was clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The coffee maker, refrigerator and the internet connection worked and the desk space was well laid out. Check-in and check-out were quick.

review.title: average quality
review.reviewText: For the expedia price it was an ok deal. If you are visiting the bay area and need to reach outer areas like Muir Woods or Monterey, this is a good, central region to stay (just north of the airport.) Positives: comfortable beds, quiet room, easy to find location Negatives: bathrooms need upgrading, as shower head was nearly broken and the toilet showed its age; located in biotech industrial area; my daughter said the small pool had a grimy bottom. Overall, good if you just want a peaceful night; go elsewhere if you're looking for four star or higher quality

review.title: Hotel is Fine..Room 213 not Best
review.reviewText: the hotel was fine, staff friendly...but room 213 was noisy and the shower smelled mildewy.

review.title: Geat place
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 4 nights and I have to say the service was top notch. room service was fast, free compurer use,frig, microwave in rooms were a big help. they even have wash& dryer to use for free. 10 min away from sf downtown.

review.title: would go back any time
review.reviewText: please check the ease of local transportation from your hotel to the places you want to see or things you what to see.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I was certain that this would be a place filled with comfortable ammenities. However, this was not the case. The beds in the room were so skinny, they were not comfortable at all. When we called down asking for an extra pillow, they said they were all out of extra pillows. When we used the indoor pool room, the echoe in that room was so loud, that it sparked migraines in a few different customers that were in there that weren't even traveling with us. I will have to say that the exercise room was nice, and the man that served us at the restaurant was very nice as well. My son got a milk that was bad at that restaurant, so the waiter gave both of our children their meals on the house. I thought that was very thoughtful. When I checked out, the woman didn't even thank me for staying with them, or ask me how everything was.

review.title: Good reviews were right!
review.reviewText: We read good things about the hotel and were happy to see that they were accurate. We always pass through SF on our way to Asia so we will be back. The only thing was the "longish" wait for the shuttle from the international airport to hotel. But otherwise, no complaints.

review.title: Excellent Choice
review.reviewText: Frontier Airlines lost my luggage and Hilton Gardens was very understanding and made my stay a pleasure. I may not fly Frontier again but I will highly recommend Hilton Garden Inns to everyone.

review.title: Comforts of home
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel for everyone. It has the most comfy beds. I commented to the front desk on how comfortable the beds were and she said that my room had a new one, so glad to know that they regularly keep up with upgrading things. I was really glad that the room had both a microwave and frig. It helped when I brought my leftover dinner back and had it for a late night snack. I also like that the hotel had a small restaurant that stayed open till 10pm. The front desk was very helpful when I had trouble with the internet. The hallway near the elevator was a little dirty. I was glad that hotel was near a bank but no other resturants nearby. However great close access to the freeway and airport. I also like that it was in a business area so it is nice an quiet in the evenings without all the city underneath your window. Overall I would reccomend this hotel to all.

review.title: FirePlace for Two!
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I had just come from NY,Manhattan. High priced closet hotel. Over rated. However, when we got to the Hilton in So. San Fran. We slept in. Got up and enjoyed a full breakfast.Excellent of choice. And relaxed next at the warm Fireplace , early morning. Quiet, no question over the service.Away from city, but only minutes from Fisherman's Wharf,and airport. We never got lost, from any direction. Loved it.We will be back.

review.title: Surprised
review.reviewText: Needed to stay overnight near the area. I found my self surprised about this hotel. Staff was friendly, room was clean and checkout was quick. The hotel was also located in a very quiet area. Did not hear the planes above or traffic below.

review.title: Fair price
review.reviewText: Parking free

review.title: Great hotel outside of San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was great for travelers. There is a restaurant in the lobby as well as a small pantry store where snack items, toiletries, and some small souvenirs can be purchased. There lobby was cozy, and the front desk had free chocolate chip cookies. Our queen double room was spacious and clean. This is a comfortable hotel, and we recommend it.

review.title: A Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Clean, friendly, and convenient.

review.title: Very comfortable
review.reviewText: Gave a great recommendation for an Italian restaurant with the best food ever.

review.title: Family Friendly
review.reviewText: Rooms were clean and quiet. Hotel was only 10 minutes from downtown. Would definitely stay again.

review.title: Don't eat there!
review.reviewText: While the room and the service were excellent, the food was a major disapointment. My "London Broil" was pot roast at best, tough and tasteless pot roast at that. My daughter's "Vegetarian Wellington" was a weird dish consisting of veggies in puff pastry on top of pasta, with a side of rice??!! My husband's "Shrimp Newberg" was whole shrimps stuck into tomato slices. The soup was so thick it held a spoon upright.

review.title: Nice and clean
review.reviewText: I would defenite go back there again

review.title: Comfortable Hotel
review.reviewText: This was a nice clean hotel. The beds are only doubles if you have two in one room and that was a little squishy for two adults. Since the hotel doesn't have a continental breakfast, it was nice to have a refridgerator and microwave. The kids loved the pool and we always had it to ourselves although many times the pool towels were not stocked.

review.title: Clean, New, Quiet, easy parking and 10 minutes from DT San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very convenient from the San Francisco airport with learge clean parking lot and only a short ride to get downtown. Downtown hotels charge additionally for parking. Has complementary business center as well.

review.title: Two polar different experiences in one hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed in the hotel our first night in San Francisco and were very pleased. We had a room on the 5th floor and it was clean, comfortable, very quiet and the desk staff pleasant. We returned to the hotel 5 days later and were given a smoking room, when we request non-smoking, and it was next to a stairwell where it was extremely noisy. We were surprised to find the hallway full of dirty dishes, the curtains in our room falling off the wall, furniture missing and the shower was growing mold. We requested a new room and were accommodated but made to feel we were being bothersome. It was like we had come to a totally different hotel.

review.title: Very convenient, nice staff, clean and comfy
review.reviewText: Close to 101 and airport but very quiet; in a business park in South San Francisco. Excellent!

review.title: I Would Certainly Stay Again
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I were in town for an Oakland A's game, even though we were attending the game in Oakland, we didn't want to hassle with bad parking and such. Parking here was great, staff was very helpful and room was great! I strongly recommend this hotel.

review.title: I would stay there again
review.reviewText: If you're willing to make an approximately 5-7 minute drive to reach downtown SF, then this hotel is perfect for you. Parking is free, there is a small refrigerator, coffee maker, television with cable and even optional nintendo in the room. My sisters and I traveled there with a two year old and the room was perfect, refrigerator for baby bottles and bathtub for her to play in. There is also a restaurant in the lobby and a small store. Great quiet and very safe location outside of downtown.

review.title: very happy
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, dinner was great, people at the front desk very helpful

review.title: very good hotel
review.reviewText: Very good hotel 10 minuts drive from downtwon S.F. very clean. For this price in S.F. very good deal!!!

review.title: Good Hotle
review.reviewText: Would go back

review.title: good, standard hotel room
review.reviewText: Staff was extremely efficient and courteous. The room was typical for a chain hotel - clean, spacious, nice for business travel. Only negative was the cheap construction of the building. But overall an excellent stay

review.title: Very Pleased
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Very clean and quiet.
